elements.title: yellow-spotted emerald (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a yellow-spotted emerald (pictured) specimen was found for the first time in the United Kingdom in 2018, when a wildlife photographer used Twitter to identify it?

elements.title: 2022 Las Vegas Bowl (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that an NFL scheduling decision forced ESPN to change the kickoff times and television networks of the 2022 Las Vegas Bowl and the 2022 New Mexico Bowl?

elements.title: Reflections of a Nonpolitical Man (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Nobel laureate Thomas Mann reportedly did not want his Reflections of a Nonpolitical Man to be translated into English during his lifetime due to its chauvinistic content?

elements.title: Ariana Orrego (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ariana Orrego was the first Peruvian gymnast to compete at the Olympic Games?

elements.title: cold pad batch (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the cold pad batch method halves the amount of water needed to dye cotton with reactive dyes?

elements.title: Big Stan drill rig (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Big Stan drill rig is claimed to be the largest vehicle-mounted drilling rig in the United States?

elements.title: bakers in ancient Rome (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the wealth of bakers in ancient Rome may have contributed to them receiving a negative reputation?

elements.title: Charles F. Barlow (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Charles F. Barlow helped to fund his medical education with his magic act, The Great Barloni?
